intro: Pavetta canarica, commonly known as the Canary pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It produces small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers clustered in terminal panicles. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
